IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A CULTURALLY SENSITIVE MEDICAL HOME, ESPECIALLY FOR REFUGEE AND LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY MEMBERS, FACILITATING WELLNESS AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY BY ADDRESSING HEALTH, EDUCATION, ECONOMIC AND SPIRITUAL BARRIERS IN ORDER TO DEMONSTRATE JESUS' UNCONDITIONAL LOVE FOR THE WHOLE PERSON.JERICHO ROAD MINISTRIES INC, DBA JERICHO ROAD COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER (THE ORGANIZATION), HAS A SHARED HISTORY AS JERICHO ROAD FAMILY PRACTICE (JRFP) AND JERICHO ROAD MINISTRIES (JRM). FOUNDED BY DR. MYRON AND JOYCE CLICK, JRFP HAS PROVIDED EXCELLENT PRIMARY MEDICAL CARE IN UNDERSERVED PARTS OF BUFFALO SINCE 1997. JRM WAS FOUNDED IN 2001 AS A PARTNER MINISTRY TO PROVIDE MORE HOLISTIC CARE WITH SOCIAL SERVICES THAT ADDRESS POVERTY AT ITS ROOTS. IN SEPTEMBER 2013, JRM PURCHASED THE ASSETS OF JRFP AND BEGAN OPERATIONS AS A NEW YORK STATE ARTICLE 28 DIAGNOSTIC AND TREATMENT CENTER (D&TC) TO EXPAND SERVICES AND PROVIDE MORE INTEGRATED, COMPREHENSIVE CARE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE A CULTURALLY SENSITIVE MEDICAL HOME, ESPECIALLY FOR REFUGEE AND LOW-INCOME COMMUNITY MEMBERS, FACILITATING WELLNESS AND SELF-SUFFICIENCY BY ADDRESSING HEALTH, EDUCATION, ECONOMIC AND SPIRITUAL BARRIERS IN ORDER TO DEMONSTRATE JESUS' UNCONDITIONAL LOVE FOR THE WHOLE PERSON.
IRS990.Desc: MEDICAL PROGRAMS: JRCHC OFFERS FULL SPECTRUM PRIMARY CARE, SERVING OVER 17,000 PATIENTS ACROSS THE EAST AND WEST SIDES OF BUFFALO.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUPPORT PROGRAMS: IN ORDER TO PROVIDE MORE HOLISTIC SERVICES, JRCHC OFFERS COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMMING TO ADDRESS HEALTH, EDUCATION, ECONOMIC, AND SPIRITUAL BARRIERS. THIS INCLUDES SERVICES SUCH AS PREGNANCY MENTORING, EARLY CHILDHOOD LITERACY, FINANCIAL AND HOMEOWNERSHIP CLASSES, ENGLIGH LANGUAGE LEARNING SUPPORT, SPIRITUAL CARE, LIFE SKILLS DEVELOPMENT, AND MORE IN ORDER TO FACILITATE WELLNESS AND SELF-SUFFICINECY IN THE LIVES OF THOSE WE SERVE.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: GLOBAL HEALTH OUTREACH: JRCHC HAS ESTABLISHED TWO PRIMARY CARE CLINICS IN SIERRA LEONE, AND ONE CLINIC IN GOMA, DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO. THEY PROVIDE OVERSIGHT, RESOURCES AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO EACH OF THESE CLINICS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM TAXATION UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. IT IS HIGHLY CERTAIN THAT SOME POSITIONS TAKEN FOR INCOME TAX PURPOSES WOULD BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE TAXING AUTHORITIES, WHILE OTHERS ARE SUBJECT TO UNCERTAINTY ABOUT THE MERITS OF THE POSITION TAKEN OR THE AMOUNT OF THE POSITION THAT WOULD BE ULTIMATELY SUSTAINED. THE BENEFIT OF A TAX POSITION IS RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ONLY TO THE EXTENT THAT AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION (IF ANY) IS ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE ORGANIZATION.
EXPENDITURES ARE REPORTED ON THE ACCRUAL BASIS OF ACCOUNTING.

LoansBtwnOrgInterestedPrsnGrp.LoanPurposeTxt: AMOUNT DUE TO GLICK FOR THE PURCHASE OF HIS BUSINESS

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.RelationshipDescriptionTxt: FAMILY MEMBER OF MYRON GLICK, OFFICER

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN SEPTEMBER 2013, THE ORGANIZATION PURCHASED THE ASSETS OF JRFP AND PROCEEDED WITH MERGING OPERATIONS. IN NOVEMBER 2013, THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED DESIGNATION AS A FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER (FQHC), ONE OF 236 NEW PRIMARY CARE SITES AWARDED UNDER THE AFFORDABLE CARE ACT. COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS HAVE SERVED AS OUR NATION'S HEALTHCARE SAFETY NET FOR THE PAST 45 YEARS, PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE, CULTURALLY COMPETENT, QUALITY PRIMARY HEALTHCARE SERVICES TO MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES AND VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. THIS STRATEGIC CHANGE HAD BEEN EXPLORED AND PLANNED OVER THE PAST SIX YEARS, ENGAGING BOARD, STAFF AND CONSULTANT SUPPORT TO ACHIEVE IMPLEMENTATION. THE ORGANIZATION SERVES APPROXIMATELY 17,000 PATIENTS THROUGH MORE THAN 66,000 PATIENT VISITS A YEAR. EIGHTY PERCENT OF PATIENTS ARE EITHER ENROLLED IN MEDICAID OR ARE UNINSURED, AND MORE THAN HALF DO NOT SPEAK ENGLISH AS THEIR NATIVE LANGUAGE. THE ORGANIZATION OVERCOMES THE LANGUAGE AND CULTURAL BARRIERS OF THOSE SERVED BY ENGAGING A CULTURALLY DIVERSE STAFF, REPRESENTATIVE OF THE COMMUNITY. IN ADDITION TO PRIMARY MEDICAL CARE, THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES SERVICES SUCH AS PREGNANCY MENTORING, EARLY CHILDHOOD LITERACY, FINANCIAL AND HOMEOWNERSHIP CLASSES, ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNING SUPPORT, SPIRITUAL CARE, LIFE SKILLS DEVELOPMENT, AND MORE TO SERVE PATIENTS HOLISTICALLY. THE ORGANIZATION ENGAGES IN MANY COLLABORATIVE AND STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS, REFERRING CLIENTS TO EXISTING COMMUNITY SERVICES AND WORKING WITH COMPLIMENTARY SERVICE ENTITIES TO PROVIDE COORDINATED, IMPROVED AND UNDUPLICATED SERVICES. HUNDREDS OF VOLUNTEERS FROM AREA CHURCHES AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES ARE ENGAGED WITH THE ORGANIZATION IN MEANINGFUL SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES EACH YEAR. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO OPERATES GLOBAL HEALTH OUTREACH INITIATIVES IN TWO AFRICAN NATIONS, SIERRA LEONE AND THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO (DRC). THE TWO CLINICS IN SIERRA LEONE ARE LED BY A JRCHC STAFF MEMBER (AN RN) NATIVE TO SIERRA LEONE, WHO RETURNED TO ESTABLISH, OPERATE AND GROW TWO OF THE THREE PRIMARY CARE CLINICS. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL SIERRA LEONEANS AND OTHER WNY ORGNANIZATIONS THROUGH THE SIERRA LEONE ALLIANCE, BOTH PRIMARY CARE AND SUPPORTING SERVICES ARE BEING PROVIDED. JRCHC'S CLINIC IN GOMA, DRC IS IN OPERATION FOR PRIMARY CARE AND SUPPORTING SERVICES IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE NEW HOPE CENTER. THE ORGANIZATION IS LED BY FOUNDER AND CHIEF EXCUTIVE OFFICER, DR. MYRON GLICK. CLAITY MASSEY, PH.D. PRESIDES OVER THE JRCHC BOARD OF DIRECTORS, WHICH IS COMPOSED OF OVER 50% PATIENTS. THE ORGANIZATION HAS ATTAINED THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF RECOGNITION AS PATIENT-CENTERED MEDICAL HOME BY THE NATIONAL COMMITTEE FOR QUALITY ASSURANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS,CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC VIA THEIR WEBSITE, OR UPON REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
